channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Is Trump making the Iranian regime nervous after the Venezuela strike?
Are Americans ditching pizza for Mexican food?
Why Nepal’s Gen Z is angry with the government it helped install after 2025 protests
Lego's biggest change in 50 years: What are the ‘smart bricks’ that light up and change colours?
Who is Tina Shah, the Indian American doctor running for US Congress in New Jersey?
Who is Lalu Yadav's grandson, Aditya, receiving military training in Singapore?
Why western media acts more pious than the Pope on Venezuela raid when even Trump insists that it’s all about oil
item.description: Regardless of the immorality or illegality of Trump’s predatory foreign policy, it is evident that the western media will inevitably take on the role of the ‘guardians of the Empire’

item.title: Ten global conflicts that make 2026 the year of uncertainty
item.description: From Trumpian volatility and Russian nuclear posturing to Chinese assertion: a deep dive into ten escalating global conflicts that make 2026 an uncertain year for humanity and world stability

item.title: Fake photos, real threats: Pakistan’s doctored imagery and the future of conflict
item.description: Future conflicts may be fought as much through fabricated visuals and engineered narratives as through missiles and manoeuvre. Nations that fail to prepare for this cognitive domain risk losing not battles—but belief

item.title: Why Venezuela? The strategic logic behind Trump’s boldest gamble
item.description: The more the US interferes in Venezuela, the more the latter might drift into chaos. If it does, it would be a bigger threat to the US than it is today, as it lies in its backyard

item.title: How Khaleda Zia’s death and Rahman’s return may impact Bangladesh’s polls
item.description: The next general election in Bangladesh is likely to be held on February 12, and until that election takes place, it remains difficult to clearly discern the country’s political trajectory

item.title: The seduction of surgical strikes: Why history should temper today's applause
item.description: The applause surrounding Caracas should be restrained, not amplified. Strategic maturity lies not in celebrating capability, but in understanding its limits
